Opinion | The Great Asian Reconciliatio.content: He even says the 21st century belongs to the CIA (China, India, and ASEAN) countries.Sure, it might sound crazy to suggest that India and China should become trusted partners like the US and India, or Russia and China.Read | Modi-Hasina Should Worry About China, But Not Too MuchThe US and its allies might be shocked and deeply concerned by a close India-China partnership.As Prime Minister, he has visited China twice, and President Xi Jinping reciprocated with two visits to India.Read | China Is Revamping Its Military, And India Must Not Take It LightlyProjections show that the Indian economy will surpass Germany and Japan's to become the world's third-largest one by 2027.

How Tech Firm Employee Planned And Exec.content: Tyrese Haspil (left) killed his boss Fahim Saleh in 2020Tyrese Haspil, a former assistant of tech mogul Fahim Saleh, has been convicted of murdering his former boss in his Manhattan apartment back in 2020.When Mr Saleh discovered the theft in January 2020, Haspil agreed to a repayment plan but continued to steal more money through a fraudulent PayPal account.He then left the apartment and returned the next day to dismember Mr Saleh's body with an electric saw.Execution of the murderOn July 13, 2020, Tyrese Haspil entered an elevator with Mr Saleh in the latter's apartment building wearing a dark plastic face shield, a baseball cap and sunglasses.Planning the murderTyrese Haspil's scheme to steal from his former boss, Fahim Saleh, began in 2018, but it wasn't until July 2020 that his plan turned deadly.

Woman Who Killed 3 Daughters Jailed For.content: A New Zealand judge on Wednesday sentenced a woman to 18 years imprisonment for murdering her three young daughters in 2021."I take responsibility for taking our three beautiful girls from this world," said Lauren Dickason."I take responsibility for taking our three beautiful girls from this world," she said."Dickason was found guilty last August on three counts of murder having smothered her two-year-old twins Maya and Karla and first daughter Liane, six.The family had moved to New Zealand from South Africa just weeks before.

South Korean Airport Briefly Shuts Due.content: Takeoffs and landings at South Korea's Incheon International Airport were disrupted on Wednesday for about three hours before dawn because of balloons launched by North Korea filled with refuse, an airport spokesperson said.North Korea has said the balloons are retaliation for a propaganda campaign by North Korean defectors and activists in the South who regularly send over balloons carrying food, medicine, money and leaflets criticising the North's leaders.Among the items carried by the North Korean balloons have been articles printed with Hello Kitty characters, badly worn clothing, and soil containing traces of human faeces and parasites, South Korea has said.North Korea has flown balloons carrying trash into South Korea since late May, with hundreds landing in South Korea.South Korea's military said about 100 balloons had fallen to the ground between Tuesday and Wednesday.

US Woman, 18, Arrested For Calling 911.content: Ms Thomas was arrested on June 16 on two false reporting charges, both of which were misdemeanour crimes, The Independent reported.According to The Independent, the woman, identified as Sumaya Thomas, was arrested after cops said she told a dispatcher that her abusive ex-boyfriend of two years was outside her home and sending her threatening text messages.Ms Thomas was arrested on two false reporting charges.(Representative pic)An 18-year-old woman in the United States has been arrested for calling 911 to avoid going on a date with a man she met on a dating app.It was during a third interview that Ms Thomas admitted to making the false report because she got "cold feet on meeting him and no longer wanted to".

Julian Assange Walks Out Of US Court As.content: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange was freed by a court on the US Pacific island territory of Saipan on Wednesday after pleading guilty to violating US espionage law, in a deal that will see him return home to Australia.During the three-hour hearing, Assange pled guilty to one criminal count of conspiring to obtain and disclose classified U.Australian-born Assange spent more than five years in a British high-security jail and seven holed up in the Ecuadorean embassy in London as he fought accusations of sex crimes in Sweden and battled extradition to the U.The Australian government has been advocating for his release with the United States several times.The Australian government has been advocating for his release and has raised the issue with the United States several times.

Nepalese Spiritual Leader 'Buddha Boy'.content: He could face at least 12 years in jail but can still appeal against his conviction.He could face at least 12 years in jail, but can still appeal his conviction.The leader whose real name is Ram Bahadur Bomjan was arrested in January for the sexual assault of a minor as well as suspicion of involvement in the disappearance of at least four of his devotees.On the run for years, the 33-year-old was arrested by officials from Nepal's Central Investigation Bureau this January on the outskirts of Kathmandu in January this year.The 33-year-old guru, whom his followers believe to be the reincarnation of Gautam Buddha, became famous as a teenager after followers said he could meditate motionless for months without water, food, or sleep.

\"Welcome Development\": Australian PM.content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese called Assange's US plea deal hearing a "welcome development".Australia's prime minister hailed WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange's US plea deal hearing Wednesday as a "welcome development"."This is a welcome development, but we recognise as well that these proceedings are sensitive and should be respected," Prime Minister Anthony Albanese told reporters in Canberra."The plea is part of an agreement that is expected to free Assange to return to his native Australia within hours.There is nothing to be gained from his continued incarceration and we want him brought home to Australia," the Australian leader said.

Princess Diana's Gowns, Shoes, Handbags.content: The biggest auction of Diana memorabilia since the late British princess sold dozens of outfits months before her death gets underway in California this week, featuring a midnight blue tulle dress and a flamenco-style lace-up number.Explore the elegance of Princess Diana through the eyes of designer Victor Edelstein â€“ his voice and vision come to life in our Royal Collection auction where his best creations for Lady Di grace the auction block at last.Highlights include Arbeid's blue diamante ball gown, which the princess wore in 1986 to the London premiere of Andrew Lloyd Webber's "The Phantom of the Opera," and a magenta lace dress by Edelstein."Princess Diana's Elegance & A Royal Collection," brings together some of the style maven's favourite designers, including Victor Edelstein, Murray Arbeid and Catherine Walker.The princess wore this blue ball gown to the London premiere of "The Phantom of the Opera," in 1986.

Israel Set To Roll Out Plan To Replace.content: Speaking at Reichman University's annual Herzliya Conference, Hanegbi said that the collapse of Hamas's military ability to rule will open opportunities "for countries that want to see a governing alternative to Hamas in Gaza, with local leadership in Gaza, to join this process.Israel will "soon" roll out a plan to replace Hamas governance in northern Gaza, Israeli National Security Advisor Tzachi Hanegbi said on Tuesday.Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has stressed that Israel's three war aims are the destruction of Hamas's military and governing capabilities, the return of all hostages, and ensuring that Gaza no longer poses a threat to Israel."He explained that Gaza's new leadership will include Israel's Abraham Accords partners, the United States, the European Union and the United Nations, while the Israeli military continues "cleansing the area" of Hamas's presence."In an interview with the US-based Punchbowl News on Friday, Netanyahu said a demilitarized post-war Gaza will be overseen by a civilian-run administration with the assistance of Arab countries.

As Israel, Iran-Backed Hezbollah Exchan.content: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin met his Israeli counterpart Yoav Gallant at the Pentagon on Tuesday, warning that a conflict between Israel and Hezbollah could spark a regional war and urging a diplomatic solution.US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin met his Israeli counterpart Yoav Gallant at the Pentagon on Tuesday.The Israeli army said last week that plans for an offensive in Lebanon were "approved and validated" amid escalating cross-border clashes, but Washington is seeking to lower the temperature and head off another major conflict in the Middle East.Gallant met with Secretary of State Antony Blinken in Washington the previous day, with the top US diplomat calling on Israel to avoid escalation in Lebanon.The Israeli minister also held talks with CIA chief Bill Burns, the key US point man in negotiations to free hostages from Hamas, which launched an unprecedented attack on Israel in October that sparked a devastating conflict in Gaza.

Indians In Kenya Asked To Limit \"Non-E.content: In view of the prevailing tense situation, all Indians in Kenya are advised to exercise utmost caution, restrict non-essential movement and avoid the areas affected by the protests and violence till the situation clears up," the Indian consulate in Kenya said in an advisory posted on social media platform X.ADVISORY FOR INDIAN NATIONALS IN KENYAIn view of the prevailing tense situation, all Indians in Kenya are advised to exercise utmost caution, restrict non-essential movement and avoid the areas affected by the protests and violence till the situation clears up.(File)India has advised its citizens in Kenya to exercise utmost caution and restrict non-essential movement amid violent protests in the East African nation against the government's proposed tax hikes.""Please follow local news and Mission's website and social media handles for updates," it added.

WikiLeaks Says Julian Assange To Fly To.content: Assange, 52, pleaded guilty at the US court in Saipan to a single count of conspiracy to obtain and disseminate US national defence information.WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange will fly to the Australian capital Canberra within hours following a plea deal to set him free, the whistleblower website said Wednesday.Julian Assange expected to depart within 3 hours, WikiLeaks said.To Canberra, Australia," WikiLeaks said in a social media post, as Assange faced court in the Pacific US territory of the Northern Mariana Islands."Guilty to the information," Assange said in court, later joking to the judge that whether he is satisfied "depends on the outcome of the hearing".

US Voters Prefer Trump On Economy, Bide.content: Trump was favored 40% to 35% on foreign conflicts and terrorism.Donald Trump was favored 40% to 35% on foreign conflicts and terrorism.Biden also had an edge over Trump on healthcare policy - 40% to 29%.Trump, who was convicted last month on criminal charges he falsified business records, is awaiting three more criminal trials, two of which are tied to his efforts to overturn his 2020 election loss to Biden.Previous Reuters/Ipsos polls have shown Biden and Trump neck-and-neck in the presidential race, though a number of polls in battleground states have shown Trump ahead in recent months.

WikiLeaks Founder Julian Assange Pleads.content: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange pleaded guilty in a US court in Saipan on Wednesday, AFP reporters said, in a plea bargain that will leave him a free man after years of legal drama.WikiLeaks' Julian Assange landed in Saipan for US plea-deal court hearing on Wednesday.In the first official US reax to the plea deal, State Department spokesman Matthew Miller said that as the case is about to go before a judge, "I think it's appropriate for me to not comment on the matter at this time.He was released Monday from a high-security British prison where he had been held for five years while he fought extradition to the United States.The announcement of the deal came two weeks before Assange was scheduled to appear in court in Britain to appeal against a ruling that approved his extradition to the United States.
